Sentencas: Kinetics of high temperature oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) on La2NiO4+delta (LNO) nanostructures are investigated by means of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, with the aim of determining (i) the critical steps that govern ORR in these catalysts, and (ii) ways to lower the overpotential losses associated with these steps.
Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides

Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides

Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides

Sentencas: find that the nanostructure of LNO significantly effects the activation barriers associated with these processes with nanorod-structured LNO catalyst, highly terminated by [001] surface facets, exhibiting lower barriers compared to traditional, spherical-shaped catalysts.
Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides

Sentencas: We also show that incorporation of the nanorod-structured LNO as cathode electrocatalysts in SOFCs leads to a significant improvement in the cell performance.
Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides

Sentencas: These findings provide important insights on the electrochemical steps that govern ORR kinetics on LNO electrocatalyst, and ways to optimize these materials as cathode electrocatalysts for intermediate temperature SOFCs (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Optimizing cathode materials for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): Oxygen reduction on nanostructured lanthanum nickelate oxides
